biogHist.abstract: Artefacts is a record series held by the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. Photographs, books, foundation stones, paintings and other memorabilia relating to children's Homes run by the Salvation Army in WA are held in this series. New items are added as they are received. These artefacts are on display in the Salvation Army's Heritage Museum in Northbridge, Perth.
biogHist.p: Access to the items in the series is open, but it is essential to make an appointment to view.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Children's Homes Collection held by Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA (1898 - )
Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Army's Homes for Wayward Girls

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Newspaper item on display
archref.unittitle: The Army's Homes for Wayward Girls
archref.abstract: 'The Army's Homes for Wayward Girls' Australians' is a digital copy of an item that is part of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Artefacts series of records. It is an article from the Salvation Army's newspaper, The War Cry, and is on display in the museum. It gives insight into practices at Salvation Army Homes in 1908. There is an image of girls and staff at the Salvation Army Industrial School for Girls, Collie.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Image on display
archref.abstract: 'Rescue Home Perth' is a digital copy of an item that is part of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Artefacts series of records. The item is a photocopied excerpt from The War Cry dated 21 March 1992 that is on display in the museum and that is also held in the Summer St. Rescue Home closed social work file, in the Children's Homes series of records. The version held in the file has a typed caption identifies the location of the Home as 192 Claisebrook Road, East Perth and reports that the sketch was made in 2001 by Peter Harper. It shows house used by the Salvation Army Home for Neglected Girls as it looked in 2001.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The young residents of the Collie Girls Home, 1901-1920

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Image on display
archref.unittitle: The young residents of the Collie Girls Home, 1901-1920
archref.abstract: 'The young residents of the Collie Girls Home, 1901-1920' is a digital copy of an item that is part of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Artefacts series of records. The item is a photocopied excerpt from The War Cry dated 21 March 1992 that is on display in the museum. The image of the Collie Girls' Home is undated but would be 1901-1920.
